intro: Conostylis pauciflora, commonly known as the few-flowered conostylis, is a flowering plant native to Australia. It belongs to the family Goodeniaceae and is characterized by its slender, erect stems and small, tubular flowers. The plant typically grows in sandy or rocky soils in arid and semi-arid regions. Its flowers are usually pale blue or white, and it is often found in open habitats such as grasslands and shrublands. Conostylis pauciflora is adapted to withstand drought and is an important component of local ecosystems.
